column3: Tried this with a self signed certificate. ~~Did not work and `vmsize` was still a multiple of 0x1000~~\n\nApparently my gitian is doing something incorrectly. Running the apply locally works as expected and the correct binary is produced.

Tested ACK a4118c6e200e02e7560f8bc213697aa2909d95b1 - removed the osx cache, built commit a4118c6e200e02e7560f8bc213697aa2909d95b1 for osx in gitian (dependency where built, patch was applied), signed on my signing mac (detach-sig-create), ran gitian osx signer with the produces signature and the a4118c6e200e02e7560f8bc213697aa2909d95b1 build (detach-sig-apply), signature then was successful verif

### Gitian builds | File | commit eec9366f7dd60e522ab339d69a0052a57598829a
(master) | commit 31bfd2e433dd526464096e8f38ba1f49411dcd0b
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-core-linux-22-res.yml | [`caad1af8b3475755...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/eec9366f7dd60e522ab339d69a0052a57598829a/bitcoin-core-linux-22-res.yml) |

While this patch looks simple, it feels like black magic (at least without the PR description), so I currently prefer #20638. Also given this is patching `libstuff`, the change ends up in all of the tools, rather than being targeted to `codesign`* in some way.

Updated PR description.\n\n@fanquake It's easy to trace which functions in cctools call get_segalign_from_flag (the only function that accesses the modified field): it's `codesign_allocate`, `lipo`, `segedit`, and `bitcode_strip`. I believe we only use the former.
